content.rendered: Ibuka Rwanda is an umbrella organisation established in 1995 to advocate for the rights and welfare of survivors of the 1994 Genocide against the Tutsi. It focuses on remembrance, justice, and support for survivors through programmes in legal aid, trauma healing, social and economic empowerment, and genocide prevention. Ibuka plays a key role in preserving memory, promoting unity, and ensuring that genocide survivors receive necessary assistance.

excerpt.rendered: Groupe des Ancient Etudiant Rescapees du Genocide (GAERG) is a non-governmental, non-profit organization of educated genocide survivors getting together to preserve the memory of the genocide against Tutsi, and restore families to overcome post-genocide consequences through education,capacity building, and a strong survivors’ network.
